intro: Navarretia mac-gregorii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Navarretia mac-gregorii is a short-lived perennial that blooms in early spring, contributing to the floral diversity of its native ecosystems.
